name: array_change_key_case
desc: Changes all keys in an array to lowercase or uppercase

name: array_chunk
desc: Splits an array into chunks of arrays

name: array_column
desc: Returns the values from a single column in the input array

name: array_combine
desc: Creates an array by using the elements from one 'keys' array and one 'values' array

name: array_count_values
desc: Counts all the values of an array

name: array_diff
desc: Compare arrays, and returns the differences (compare values only)

name: array_diff_assoc
desc: Compare arrays, and returns the differences (compare keys and values)

name: array_diff_key
desc: Compare arrays, and returns the differences (compare keys only)

name: array_diff_uassoc
desc: Compare arrays, and returns the differences (compare keys and values, using a user-defined key comparison function)

name: array_diff_ukey
desc: Compare arrays, and returns the differences (compare keys only, using a user-defined key comparison function)

name: array_fill
desc: Fills an array with values

name: array_fill_keys
desc: Fills an array with values, specifying keys

name: array_filter
desc: Filters the values of an array using a callback function

name: array_flip
desc: Flips/Exchanges all keys with their associated values in an array

name: array_intersect
desc: Compare arrays, and returns the matches (compare values only)

name: array_intersect_assoc
desc: Compare arrays and returns the matches (compare keys and values)

name: array_intersect_key
desc: Compare arrays, and returns the matches (compare keys only)

name: array_intersect_uassoc
desc: Compare arrays, and returns the matches (compare keys and values, using a user-defined key comparison function)

name: array_intersect_ukey
desc: Compare arrays, and returns the matches (compare keys only, using a user-defined key comparison function)

name: array_key_exists
desc: Checks if the specified key exists in the array

name: array_keys
desc: Returns all the keys of an array

name: array_map
desc: Sends each value of an array to a user-made function, which returns new values

name: array_merge
desc: Merges one or more arrays into one array

name: array_merge_recursive
desc: Merges one or more arrays into one array recursively

name: array_multisort
desc: Sorts multiple or multi-dimensional arrays

name: array_pad
desc: Inserts a specified number of items, with a specified value, to an array

name: array_pop
desc: Deletes the last element of an array

name: array_product
desc: Calculates the product of the values in an array

name: array_push
desc: Inserts one or more elements to the end of an array

name: array_rand
desc: Returns one or more random keys from an array

name: array_reduce
desc: Returns an array as a string, using a user-defined function

name: array_replace
desc: Replaces the values of the first array with the values from following arrays

name: array_replace_recursive
desc: Replaces the values of the first array with the values from following arrays recursively

name: array_reverse
desc: Returns an array in the reverse order

name: array_search
desc: Searches an array for a given value and returns the key

name: array_shift
desc: Removes the first element from an array, and returns the value of the removed element

name: array_slice
desc: Returns selected parts of an array

name: array_splice
desc: Removes and replaces specified elements of an array

name: array_sum
desc: Returns the sum of the values in an array

name: array_udiff
desc: Compare arrays, and returns the differences (compare values only, using a user-defined key comparison function)

name: array_udiff_assoc
desc: Compare arrays, and returns the differences (compare keys and values, using a built-in function to compare the keys and a user-defined function to compare the values)

name: array_udiff_uassoc
desc: Compare arrays, and returns the differences (compare keys and values, using two user-defined key comparison functions)

name: array_uintersect
desc: Compare arrays, and returns the matches (compare values only, using a user-defined key comparison function)

name: array_uintersect_assoc
desc: Compare arrays, and returns the matches (compare keys and values, using a built-in function to compare the keys and a user-defined function to compare the values)

name: array_uintersect_uassoc
desc: Compare arrays, and returns the matches (compare keys and values, using two user-defined key comparison functions)

name: array_unique
desc: Removes duplicate values from an array

name: array_unshift
desc: Adds one or more elements to the beginning of an array

name: array_values
desc: Returns all the values of an array

name: array_walk
desc: Applies a user function to every member of an array

name: array_walk_recursive
desc: Applies a user function recursively to every member of an array

name: arsort
desc: Sorts an associative array in descending order, according to the value

name: asort
desc: Sorts an associative array in ascending order, according to the value

name: compact
desc: Create array containing variables and their values

name: count
desc: Returns the number of elements in an array

name: current
desc: Returns the current element in an array

name: each
desc: Returns the current key and value pair from an array

name: end
desc: Sets the internal pointer of an array to its last element

name: extract
desc: Imports variables into the current symbol table from an array

name: in_array
desc: Checks if a specified value exists in an array

name: key
desc: Fetches a key from an array

name: krsort
desc: Sorts an associative array in descending order, according to the key

name: ksort
desc: Sorts an associative array in ascending order, according to the key

name: list
desc: Assigns variables as if they were an array

name: natcasesort
desc: Sorts an array using a case insensitive 'natural order' algorithm

name: natsort
desc: Sorts an array using a 'natural order' algorithm

name: next
desc: Advance the internal array pointer of an array

name: pos
desc: Alias of current()

name: prev
desc: Rewinds the internal array pointer

name: range
desc: Creates an array containing a range of elements

name: reset
desc: Sets the internal pointer of an array to its first element

name: rsort
desc: Sorts an indexed array in descending order

name: shuffle
desc: Shuffles an array

name: sizeof
desc: Alias of count()

name: sort
desc: Sorts an indexed array in ascending order

name: uasort
desc: Sorts an array by values using a user-defined comparison function

name: uksort
desc: Sorts an array by keys using a user-defined comparison function

name: usort
desc: Sorts an array using a user-defined comparison function
